meanings.sent1: The old fogey always wore a suit and tie, even on casual days.
meanings.sent2: My grandpa is a real fogey when it comes to technology.
meanings.sent3: The fogey insisted on writing letters instead of emails.
meanings.sent4: To the young students, the history teacher seemed like a fogey from a different era.
meanings.sent5: The town's oldest resident was a lovable fogey who told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: A person who is overly concerned with tradition or outdated ideas.
meanings.sent1: The company's fogey resisted any changes to the office layout.
meanings.sent2: Some people see him as a fogey because he still listens to music on CDs.
meanings.sent3: The fogey refused to try the new restaurant, insisting on going to the same diner every week.
meanings.sent4: In a world of innovation, the fogey clung to his rotary phone.
meanings.sent5: The young artist found it hard to relate to the fogey's strict adherence to old techniques.
